channel.title: Database Conventions on Finklen
channel.description: Recent content in Database Conventions on Finklen

item.description: Google spanner DB locality features Oracle’s multi-table index cluster tables Bigtable’s column-family

Document Model # Hierarchical structure of data nested within each other Access path for nested attributes is required Has same problem as RDBMS with respect to Joins. Data locality can be a problem for for entity. i.e. complete document is read and written every time. Some models provide sub-document lookup and updates (Couchbase)
Graph-like Data Models # Suitable for many to many relationship models Calorich M ativan 1 mg *M liposerin concor 5 mg Renerve Bt 3

item.title: RDBMS
item.description: RDBMS # Shredding Splitting an entity into multiple relationshsips [Person, Education, Experience] Schema on Write # Strict enforcement of schema unlike NoSQL databases that has loose schema (Schema on Read). Schema Changes # Schema changes are hard to change without downtime. Database migration tools must be used for easier maintance and roll backs. Liquibase Flyway
